glsa.title: TikiWiki: Arbitrary command execution
glsa.synopsis: Tikiwiki contains a command injection vulnerability which may allow remote execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: TikiWiki is an open source content management system written in PHP.

description.p: ShAnKaR reported that input passed to the "f" array parameter in tiki-graph_formula.php is not properly verified before being used to execute PHP functions.

impact.p: An attacker could execute arbitrary code with the rights of the user running the web server by passing a specially crafted parameter string to the tiki-graph_formula.php file.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All TikiWiki users should upgrade to the latest version:
